item.title: Of Ego, Fear, and Conflict: Towards a Transcendence for Conflict Resolution
item.description: Introduction: The Triad of Conflict In humanity’s constant endeavor to understand the conflictual nature of our existence, we have examined various facets of our behavior and interactions. At the heart of these reflections lie three interconnected and powerful factors: the desire to impose one’s viewpoint, fear, and ego. These three elements are often present in conflicts, whether they are interpersonal, social, or international. The desire to impose one’s viewpoint: A Breeding Ground for Conflict Let’s start with the desire to impose one’s viewpoint.
